dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Look, you can tell Catherine the new shipment'll be ready when it's ready, all right? She's welcome to come up here and pack boxes herself if she's in such a hurry.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Take it easy. I'm just looking around.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Catherine said she'd shove you in a box if you keep running your yap like that.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well, if you're that friendly about it, then you definitely aren't one of Catherine's SubLight toughs. My mistake.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hope you can forgive my temper. This job's been running me ragged lately.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: First my auto loader foreman stages a walkout, and now my chief pescatological health manager is missing.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm here to ask about Grimm's poster.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't have time for this.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: This again? I swear, this is the last time I contract for any special requests.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: You can tell Grimm his poster came in. You can also tell him I got a better offer for it. So now it's going to Nell.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: That about cover it?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Who's Nell?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You still have the poster, right?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're just giving Grimm's poster away? Didn't he pay for it?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Surely we can work something out.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Let's talk about something else.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: She runs the betting parlor across the way. Nice, professional lady.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: She asked me about the poster once - just once. Made a real generous offer, too.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So it's about the money.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: She does sound... easier to deal with.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Damn right it is.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: I don't have time for Grimm. Even when I'm not working doubles.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: It's staying locked up in my office until Nell shows with her money.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: No, I paid SubLight for it, so it's mine. And when Nell pays me for it, it'll be hers. Grimm may have asked for the poster, but it's not his until I take his money.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Sure can. If you wanna pay me more than Nell's offering.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You won't do much business if your neighbors hate you. Consider this an investment.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Take <oeiglobal>Bribe_Amount</oeiglobal> bits for the time Grimm's wasted. He'll still pay for the poster.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: I got a feeling you and Catherine would get on like tumors on a pig.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Take the poster, then. And if I never hear another word about it, it'll be too soon.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Something else on your mind?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll talk to you later.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Damn right he will. Hopefully that'll be the last I see of him for a while.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Fine by me.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Did she, now? Well, I can see I was mistaken. 'Cause if Catherine really had sent you, there'd be a lot more expletives in your message.
